review: YouTube and Netflix work great, which is already worth it at just $35. Unfortunately, Google Play Music isn't available in Canada yet. Anxiously awaiting Rdio and Plex support. Please open that API, Google!
author: Dave Steinberg

review: The chromecast is not a bad device for the price, but when it cant perform as advertised, it becomes a disappointment not a waste of money to me. I would say it works 80% of the time, breaks connection a lot even though the router is 10 feet away, freezes and cant keep up if casting a google chrome tab. I know that last one is experimental, but it worked fine for the first month, now it stops to the point where you cant cast more than 5 minutes. Good to get this off my chest, I hope the next device fixes this silly connection problems. One more thing, google needs to let this thing lose, stop holding its power back.

review: Don't buy this product. Google does not honor the warranty unless you purchase an additional service called a Google Wallet which requires that you give Google your credit card information. I bought three of the suckers - two set up okay and one is an expensive chunk of plastic. The product's hype is far greater than it's performance. With any mobile device, you are pretty much limited to Netflix and YouTube. Google is keeping third party developers from letting you view local content, such as your own PowerPoint presentations or recorded/purchased content. Stay away.
